workflow.name: Two-way property repair management system with Google Sheets & Drive
workflow.description:
## This workflow automates the repair request process between **tenants** and **building managers**, keeping all updates organized in a single spreadsheet. It is composed of **two coordinated workflows**, as two separate triggers are required ‚Äî one for new repair submissions and another for repair updates. A **Unique Unit ID** that corresponds to individual units is attributed to each request, and **timestamps** are used to coordinate repair updates with specific requests. 

General use cases include: 
- **Property managers** who manage multiple buildings or units.
- **Building owners** looking to centralize tenant repair communication.
- **Automation builders** who want to learn multi-trigger workflow design in n8n.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

### **Workflow 1 ‚Äì New Repair Requests**

**Behind the Scenes:**
A tenant fills out a Google Form (‚ÄúRepair Request Form‚Äù), which automatically adds a new row to a linked Google Sheet.

**Steps:**

1. **Trigger:** Google Sheets `rowAdded` ‚Äì runs when a new form entry appears.
2. **Extract & Format:** Collects all relevant form data (address, unit, urgency, contacts).
3. **Generate Unit ID:** Creates a standardized identifier (e.g., `BUILDING-UNIT`) for tracking.
4. **Email Notification:** Sends the building manager a formatted email summarizing the repair details and including a **link to a Repair Update Form** (which activates Workflow 2).

---

### **Workflow 2 ‚Äì Repair Updates**

**Behind the Scenes:**\
Triggered when the building manager submits a follow-up form (‚ÄúRepair Update Form‚Äù).

**Steps:**

1. **Lookup by UUID:** Uses the Unit ID from Workflow 1 to find the existing row in the Google Sheet.
2. **Conditional Logic:**
   - **If photos are uploaded:** Saves each image to a Google Drive folder, renames files consistently, and adds URLs to the sheet.
   - **If no photos:** Skips the upload step and processes textual updates only.
3. **Merge & Update:** Combines new data with existing repair info in the same spreadsheet row ‚Äî enabling a full repair history in one place.

---

## üß© Requirements

- Google Account (for Forms, Sheets, and Drive)
- Gmail/email node connected for sending notifications
- n8n credentials configured for Google API access

---

## ‚ö° Setup Instructions (see more detail in workflow)

1. Import both workflows into n8n, then copy one into a second workflow. 
2. Change manual trigger in workflow 2 to a n8n Form node.
3. Connect Google credentials to all nodes.
4. Update spreadsheet and folder IDs in the corresponding nodes.
5. Customize email text, sender name, and form links for your organization.
6. Test each workflow with a sample repair request and a repair update submission.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Customization Ideas

- Add Slack or Telegram notifications for urgent repairs.
- Auto-create folders per building or unit for photo uploads.
- Generate monthly repair summaries using Google Sheets triggers.
- Add an AI node to create summaries/extract relevant repair data from repair request that include long submissions.

parameters.content:
## Repair Updates Submitted

-PRODUCTION URL must be in "Repair Request" email at end of Workflow 1. 
-Repair categories/questions set as FIELD NAMES in this node as.

## Google Drive

### -Add Drive Credential
### -Select folder for photo storage

## Sheets:

### -Google Sheets Credential
### -Use UUID to collect row info

parameters.message:
=

Vew Repair Log

 UUID: {{ $json['Unique Unit ID'] }}
Action: {{ $('Merge Data').item.json['Action-new']}}
Completed by: {{ $('Merge Data').item.json['nameDate-new'] }}
parameters.subject: =Repair update submitted

schema.id: Any feedback or suggestions are welcome:
schema.displayName: Any feedback or suggestions are welcome:

parameters.content:
## Combine Photo URL(s)

### -Combines URL(s) into single Key so they can be stored in 1 spreadsheet cell. 

-maintains organization of repair photos in row with original Repair Request

## Sheets:

### -Google Sheets Credential
### -Use *TIMESTAMP* as *Column to Match On*

### ‚ÄºÔ∏èField Names from the FORM SUBMITTED node (trigger), must align with Column headings in the spreadsheet. 

EX: Form question: "repair status"
Column title: "repair status"

## Optional Email:

### -Email Credential
### -Ideal for: 
-Developer to monitor initial project
-Manager to send updates to Tenant.

# Workflow 2:

## **Behind the Scenes:**
[building manager] Submits information in "repair update" form.


## How it Works:
### Top Nodes
- Uses **UUID** to collect existing info from spreadsheet row. 
### Middle Nodes (False from IF node):
- if photos submitted, uploads them to gmail folder and passes URL(s) to workflow. Loop because each much be processed separately, and coding blocks to manage naming conventions. 
### Middle (False from IF Node): 
- If no photos, pass on other new info. 

### Merge Data Node (new + existing Details)
- All Data (existing and newly added) collected in **Merge Data** node, then added to spreadsheet. 
- This allows for multiple repair updates to be collected in the same row as the Original Repair Request.

nodes.name: Report Alert + Info

=

Copy UUID then click Update Repair for repair update form:

UUID: {{ $json.uniqueUnitId }}


Request Form Input:

Address: {{ $json.building }}
Unit: {{ $json.unit }}
Urgency: {{ $json.urgency }}
Category: {{ $json.category }}
Explanation: {{ $json.explanation }}
Photos/Video: {{ $json.photosVideos }}
Feedback/Suggestions: {{ $json.feedbackSuggestions }}

Contact Methods:

  • Email: {{ $json.email }}
  • Messenger: {{ $json.contactMessenger }}
  • Phone: {{ $json.phoneNumber }}
  • In Person: {{ $json.InPerson }}
  • Best Times: {{ $json.availability }}


View Repair Request Log

parameters.content:
# Workflow 1:

## **Behind the Scenes:**
Tennant fills out Google form ("Repair Request Form") which auto-populates a new row in a spreadsheet. 

## How it Works:
#### Trigger:
- New ROW ADDED repair form submission via rowAdded.
#### Code:
- Extract the newly added entry for processing.
#### **Format:** 
 -Build display fields (address, unit, urgency, contacts) and a message body.
#### **Add Unit ID:** 
 -Generate a standardized Unit/UUID (e.g., BUILDING-UNIT) from form inputs.
#### **Email:** 
 -Send [building manager] a formatted email with repair details, contact methods, and ‚ö†Ô∏è **link to update the repair** ‚ö†Ô∏è

## Alert Email:

### -Email Credential
### -Format Data to share essential info for [building manager]
‚ö†Ô∏è ### -Include Link to N8N form ‚ö†Ô∏è

## Sheets:

### -Google Sheets Credential
### -Add UUID to row
### -Use TIMESTAMP as "Column to match on"

## REPLACE THIS TRIGGER WITH 
N8N FORM = Repair Update Form

# This template automates tenant repair requests and updates via Google Forms and Google Sheets. Two workflows handle new submissions and manager updates, ensuring all repair data stays in a single, organized row.

# Setting Up Workflow 1:

## **Behind the Scenes:**
- Create Google form ("Repair Request Form")
- Create Google Sheet to collect responses. (In "Form Responses" you can create a linked Google Sheet.)

## Nodes:
#### Trigger:
- Add Google Sheets credential. 
- Select document, sheet, poll time. 
#### **Format Data:** 
- Build display fields that apply to your Spreadsheet columns (address, unit, urgency, contacts, etc) and a message body.
- add input expressions for "address"+"unit" to create "UUID"
#### **Add Unit ID:** 
- Add Sheets credential
#### **Report Alert + Info:** 
- Add Gmail/email credential
- format information summary sent to building manager.
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **link to update the repair** ‚ö†Ô∏è --link found in **N8N Form Trigger** in Workflow 2.

# Setting Up Workflow 2:

## **Behind the Scenes:**
- Select categories(questions) for repair information to submit
- **One as Image/File**

### ‚ö†Ô∏èReplace MANUAL TRIGGER with N8N FORM trigger ‚ö†Ô∏è
‚ÄºÔ∏è**The Link to the N8N FORM trigger must be pasted to the EMAIL node at end of Workflow 1.**

## Top Nodes: 
### Get Rows:
- Add Sheets Credential
- Use **UUID** to collect existing info from spreadsheet row. 
### Existing Details:
- set required data fields
## Bottom Nodes:
### Code Nodes:
- Update file names if necessary (use AI: copy code and update with new file name) 
### Upload Repair Photo:
- Add Drive Credential
- set folder to store photos

## End Nodes:
### Merge: 
- organize data as necessary for columns
### Sheets node:
- Add Credential
- select file and sheet.
- Map java expressions to column
- Must have spreadsheet columns that exactly match all field names **including repair updates**.
### Email Node:
- Optional: to alert tenant or other about a repair update.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
